did.unittitle:
Andrew Dickson White lectures
1861-1912
did.abstract: Professor of history at University of Michigan, later President of Cornell University, Minister to Russia, and Ambassador to Germany. Printed copies of lectures and writings.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: The collection was assembled from various sources, some items originally came from the library of Corydon L. Ford.

accruals.p: No further additions to the collection are expected.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open to research.

userestrict.p: Copyright is in the public domain.

prefercite.p: [item], folder, box, Andrew Dickson White lectures, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: Professor of history at University of Michigan 1856-1865, later President of Cornell University, Minister to Russia, and Ambassador to Germany.

scopecontent.p: The Andrew Dickson White collections consists of 24 printed copies of lectures and writings on variety of topics in history and political science, and addresses delivered on ceremonial occasions.

did.unittitle: Lectures
Address at the funeral of Edward Lasker, 1884
Address on agricultural education ..., 1869
The diplomatic service of the United States, with some hints toward its reform, 1905
Education in political science, 1879
Evolution and revolution, 1890
Fiat money inflation in France ..., 1933
A letter of Andrew Dickson White, LL.D., resigning the presidency of Cornell University ..., 1885
A letter to Wm. Howard Russell, LL.D. on passages in his "Diary North and South." [London Edition], 1863
A letter to Wm. Howard Russell, LL.D. on passages in his "Diary North and South." [University of Michigan edition], 1863
The message of the nineteenth century to the twentieth, 1883
My reminiscences of Ezra Cornell ..., 1890
The new Germany, 1882
Outlines of a course of lectures on history, addressed to the senior class, (second semester, 1860), in the State University of Michigan
Outlines of a course of lectures on history ... (second semester, 1861)
A patriotic investment: Being an address ... at the Fiftieth Anniversary of the Yale Class of 1853 ..., 1903
The presidency of Cornell University, 1885
The question between the United States and Russia, 1912
The relations of the national and state governments to advanced education, 1874
Review of the Governor's message: Speech of Hon. Andrew D. White of Onondaga in Senate, March, 1864
Some important questions in higher education, 1885
Some practical influences of German thought upon the United States, 1884
Two addresses at Cleveland, Ohio, 25 and 26 October, 1882
I. On the plan of Western Reserve University
II. On the education of the freedmen
The warfare of science, 1880
